title: I want to write this line'I am dying in pain' in a poem. Here pain means the sorrows of life. Is this sentence correct? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, I would think it is correct I have heard this expression or one like it on a number of occasions. It means that something is really hurting, really hurtful if taken figuratively; if the expression (sentence) is meant literally, then it means that the physical pain is a symptom of a condition that is truly bringing death. I think people use the expression mostly in a figurative manner, and this is what you have done because you admit that “here pain means the sorrow of life.” The context of your poem will assure readers that you mean a figurative interpretation. So yes, “I am dying in pain” is very appropriate. By the way, your use of the word “dying” is significant. It is actually what poets term hyperbole, great exaggeration to make a point dramatically. It is an effective poetic technique.
As written and out of context with the rest of the poem , it suggests you are having a painful death on a physical level . “ I am dying of sorrow “ could be more in line with your intended meaning .
